Image comparison tools¶

Tools to compare RGBA images on a pixel by pixel basis

The tools in this module are designed to work with bokeh.plotting.figure.Figure.image_rgba() GlyphRenderers and ColumnDataSources that drive those images

Slider¶

A Slider is available that makes it easy to compare two images relative to a mouse pointer. The slider splits images such that the left portion of one image and the right portion of the other image are visible either side of the mouse position.

>>> slider = forest.image.Slider(left_images, right_images)
>>> slider.add_figure(figure)

Toggle¶

A Toggle switches between left/right images to give a quick overview of differences in two images. The effect is achieved by caching and modifying each images alpha values

>>> toggle = forest.image.Toggle(left_images, right_images)
>>> toggle.show_left()  # Set left image to visible
>>> def callback(attr, old, new):
...     if new == 0:
...         toggle.show_left()
...     else:
...         toggle.show_right()
>>> buttons = bokeh.models.widgets.RadioButtonGroup(
...     labels=["Left", "Right"],
...     active=0
... )
>>> buttons.on_change("active", callback)

A Toggle has no knowledge of bokeh widgets or layouts, it simply exposes methods Toggle.show_left() and Toggle.show_right() so that the user to craft their own user interface

In the example shown above, a toggle is constructed using the data sources of two bokeh RGBA images. A callback and radio button group are then created to allow the user to hide/show the appropriate images. Since the active button is Left the toggle show_left() method has been called to get the app into a consistent state

Application programming interface (API)¶

The following classes have been made available to users of Forest for custom visualisations

class forest.image.CachedRGBA(source)[source]¶

Cache alpha/shapes to maintain consistency

class forest.image.Slider(left_images, right_images)[source]¶

Controls alpha values of bokeh RGBA ColumnDataSources

Understands bokeh architecture, either a GlyphRenderer or a ColumnDataSource may be passed in for either left_images or right_images arguments

The various properties needed to set alpha values relative to the mouse position can be found by inspecting either data structure

Note

If a ColumnDataSource is passed then the following keys are used to find the image properties ‘image’, ‘x’, ‘y’, ‘dw’, ‘dh’

Parameters:
  • left_images – ColumnDataSource or GlyphRenderer used to define RGBA images to the left of the cursor
  • right_images – ColumnDataSource or GlyphRenderer used to define RGBA images to the right of the cursor
add_figure(figure)[source]¶

Attach various callbacks to a particular figure

notify_client_side()[source]¶

Listen for bokeh server-side image array changes

If a shape change is detected pass that information to client-side

class forest.image.Toggle(left_images, right_images)[source]¶

Controls alpha values of bokeh RGBA ColumnDataSources

Similar design to Slider but with wholesale replacement of image alpha values

Parameters:
  • left_images – ColumnDataSource or GlyphRenderer used to define RGBA images when toggle is set to left
  • right_images – ColumnDataSource or GlyphRenderer used to define RGBA images when toggle is set to right
hide(source)[source]¶

Hide an image

Set alpha values in RGBA arrays to zero, while keeping a copy of the original values for restoration purposes

Note

Caches existing alpha values if not already cached

Note

Updates image alpha values in-place

show(source)[source]¶

Show an image

Note

Caches existing alpha values if not already cached and exits since there is no alpha information to change

Note

Updates image alpha values in-place

show_left()[source]¶

Show left image and hide right image

show_right()[source]¶

Show right image and hide left image

forest.image.alpha_from_rgba(rgba)[source]¶

Helper method to view alpha values from an RGBA array

The alpha values are assumed to be the last entry of the last dimension

Note

This method does not handle RGBA data stored as 1D arrays

Parameters:rgba – Array of RGBA values
Returns:View on alpha values
forest.image.get_alpha(bokeh_obj)[source]¶

Helper to copy alpha values from GlyphRenderer or ColumnDataSource

forest.image.get_images(bokeh_obj)[source]¶

Helper to get image data from ColumnDataSource or GlyphRenderer

forest.image.get_shapes(source)[source]¶

Read image shapes from ColumnDataSource
